page.title: 14CUSTOMS-GOTHAM CHURCH BELLS
page.content: The church of St Lawrence has five bells.The lightest bell is the treble,which was made in Loughborough in 1910.The second bell dates from the same time.The third bell was cast in 1658 whilst the fourth and tenor are even older,and date back to 1598.The three heavier bells were all cast in Nottingham. The bell-word 'tenor' comes from the word 'teller'.In the olden days they used the teller to announce when someone had died.They rang one chime for a boy,two for a girl,three for a man and four for a woman.After an interval of five seconds,they rang out the age and the date of death. During the war years they were only allowed to ring the bells when there was an air-raid,but today bells are rung for weddings,special occasions and to call people to church.
